result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Hering was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is to repay the county for Attorney Plaisted's fees.
Pay DV surcharges plus all other costs and surcharges: civil judgment if not paid. Pay supervision fees.

Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
No contact with victim unless approved by agent.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Hering

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.  rmm
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $240.00 entered as ordered by the court on 08/05/15 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 11/02/15. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Defendant Christopher J Hering in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
As to count 2:
Pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
As to count 1:
 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing continued....
Statements by the parties.
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 20 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment as able.
-Defendant is to repay the county for Attorney Plaisted's fees.
-Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The probation review date is in Branch 40.  
Probation review hearing calendared for 09/25/2015 at 01:30 p.m.

Defendant Christopher J Hering in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Micha Schwab, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 06/04/15to repay Milwaukee County $50.00 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 08/01/15.

Defendant Christopher J Hering in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Michael Plaisted as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Attorney Plaisted accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 801/15 until paid in full. Order signed and filed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Christine M

Defendant Christopher J Hering in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Christopher J Hering in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
